SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class SQLStatement<T extends SQLStatement<T>>

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.SQLStatement<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the SQLStatement subtype returned by various methods in the fluent API.
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SQLInsert, SQLQuery, SQLUpdate
public abstract sealed class SQLStatement<T extends SQLStatement<T>> extends Object implements AutoCloseable permits SQLQuery, SQLUpdate, SQLInsert
Abstract base class for SQLQuery, SQLInsert and SQLUpdate. A SQLStatement allows you to bind the named parameters within a SQL statement and then execute it. SQLStatement instances are not thread-safe. They should be created, operated upon, and closed by one and the same thread. They are not supposed to survive the method in which they are created.

  • Method Details

    • bind

      public T bind(String param, Object value)
      Binds the specified value to the specified named parameter.
      Parameters:
      param - the named parameter
      value - the value
      Returns:
      this SQLStatement instance

    • bind

      public T bind(Object bean)
      Binds the properties of the specified JavaBean to the named parameters within the SQL statement. Properties that do not correspond to named parameters will tacitly be ignored. The effect of passing anything other than a proper JavaBean (e.g. an Integer, a String, or an array) is undefined.
      Parameters:
      bean - the bean
      Returns:
      this SQLStatement instance

    • bind

      public T bind(Record record)
      Binds the components of the specified record to the named parameters within the SQL statement. Record components that do not correspond to named parameters will tacitly be ignored.
      Parameters:
      record - the record
      Returns:
      this SQLStatement instance

    • bind

      public T bind(Map<String,?> map)
      Binds the values in the specified map to the named parameters within the SQL statement. Map keys that do not correspond to named parameters will tacitly be ignored.
      Parameters:
      map - the map whose values to bind to the named parameters within the SQL statement
      Returns:
      this SQLStatement instance

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Clears all bindings and allows the statement to be re-executed with new bindings.

    • close

      public void close()
      Releases all resources held by this instance. You cannot reuse the instance after a call to this method.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
